name: The Carriage House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A time share week in amongst an extended holiday - the Carriage house seems well organised. Security is good. The room was adequate if not over equipped - the internet is via cable only ( available for a small deposit at the check in). TV channels poorly selected and pay per view relatively expensive despite small range and not especially current. Internet available free just of the lobby. The pool was clean and tidy but we couldnt use it much due to a cold snap. The hotel is situated just off the Strip behind Planet Hollywood and has a small but well equipped exercise room.
reviews.title: Very polite friendly staff - rooms better than average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traded our timeshare in Gatlinburg, Tn for a week at the Carriage House. Even though it's a timeshare, they also book as a regular hotel. It's not the Mandaly but I would return to the Carraige House again.The front desk staff was friendly and accomodating. My dad joined us on our trip and we needed extra room. We were upgraded for very little money to the roomiest 2 bedroom suite I've ever seen. I'ts a 2 block walking distance to the noisy and crowded Vegas Blvd. but you would never know from the quietness of the hotel.One block from the Miracle Mile shopping center which has tons of shops, restaurants, and even some entertainment venues. The hotel lobby has been upgraded. The penthouse floor which is where we were at is being renovated so I assume the rest of the floors will be too.Free wi-fi and daily maid service which you would hardly never find in a timeshre resort. All in all, we highly recommend the Carriage House
reviews.title: Excellent Staff and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm surprised that the reviews for the Carriage House are so glowing. The Carriage House is an older hotel that needs a lot of work. My husband and I had booked an eight-night stay, only to cancel seven of those nights, in favor of the Paris Hotel on the Strip.
reviews.title: What's that smell? and Other Carriage House Quirkiness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most overwhelming issue my husband and I encountered when we walked into the Carriage House's tiny, claustrophobic elevator and our floor's hallway (floor 8) was the smell of what I can only figure must be air deodorizer to mask possibly the scent of times when Carriage House allowed smoking. If that's not what the smell can be attributed to, I'm not sure what it is. It is very unpleasant.
reviews.title: Best location, great value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was dingy, for the most part. The decor needs updating, as it gives off a dark, yellowed feel to everything, but more than anything the rooms need to be cleaner. The small bathroom in our king bed suite, which might possibly win the award for World's Narrowest Doorway (good thing we aren't fat!), has very old faucet fixtures that look like they need a better clean. The grout of the handicapped shower, which I assume comes automatically when you get the king bed suite, is very old and moldy, if not completely wearing away.
reviews.title: Quiet place to stay in middle of all the craziness Vegas has to offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First I would like to point out the location. Just two block from the center of the strip, you can walk to most places without to use a car or taxi. Then, the hotel is very clean and quiet since it doesn´t have a casino, so once you get back to your room it is relax time.
reviews.title: All in one

reviews.text: The hotel has a laundry room for guest to use, a nice gym (which in reality is a very good treadmill), free internet, free parking, and a nice coffemaker to enyoy every morning.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable experience with four small children.

reviews.text: I think this is a great place for people that want to enjoy a nice hotel at a great price, next to the action (not in it).
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: The location is great... close to the strip. The pool and tennis courts were clean and secure. In fact, the entire facility felt very secure as you needed a key card to enter the building after hours and a key card to ride the elevator at all. The staff was extremely helpful. We cooked and baked as if we were at home for a few nights and went out the rest. It was nice to have such spacious and clean accomodations. Thank you to the staff at Carriage House.
reviews.title: Great Price, Great Service, Good Room--bargain all around

reviews.text: Our families stay at the Carriage House was a great experience. They are located just off the strip and will convenient access to I-15. The hotel was clean and family friendly. There was no noise, casino, or night club at the hotel itself. If you want a quite place close to all the attractions, but where you are comfortable with your young children walking around this is the place. They have a small kitchen in the room. They have movies, games and pool toys you can check-out free of charge in the lobby. Parking is free and close. You don't have to walk a quarter mile from your car to the registration desk to your room like most traditional Las Vegas hotels. The staff was friendly and personable. Thank you for a great stay!
reviews.title: Brilliant location, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a fantastic stay at the Carriage House!
reviews.title: Cant wait to come back!

reviews.text: I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel. Being a former Housekeeping Manager for a pricey resort on Cape Cod, I can ALWAYS spot something unclean from a mile away- but everything was well taken care of at the Carriage House. The only thing I would say its that certain things were a bit outdated. For example, our room had a great new bed and flat screen t.v, however, the bathroom seemed in need of remodeling. But for the price- and in Las Vegas- I could not ask for more.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in vegas!!!!
"Great Stay "Great Location Terrific Staff
reviews.text: During our stay we felt as though we had the place to ourselves, never heard any sounds from anyone else, and the lobby never got to crowded - never a wait for using the computer, or needing to speak to a hotel representative. This would not hold true at any other Vegas hotel in my opinion.
We also felt very safe, as there were security and personnel working at all hours.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I notice many comments on here about the location. The location is perfect!! We were easily able to walk to and from the strip all day-- very very close. I have Rheumatoid Arthritis in my knees and ankles, so if I think it is an easy walk- it must be! The other great thing about the location is that the BEST sites on the strip are throughout the middle of the strip- which is where Carriage House is tucked behind. When you check-in, ask the representative the short-cut to the MGM- us and some other couples learned about it after we had been there a number of times.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay at Carriage House - Like Returning Home

reviews.text: As a party off three adults from the Netherlands we stayed at the Carriage House for 1 week.
reviews.title: We loved it

likes.liked: — It's in the neighbourhoud off the Las Vegas Strip

reviews.text: The frontdeskmembers were during the week very polite and friendly.
reviews.title: Great stay with family

reviews.text: The grocery service is great after a long travel.
reviews.title: Best in las vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is very clean , and big enough for three adults.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: Just a short walk to MM shops off planet Hollywood so the location is perfect.
reviews.title: Absolutely The Best Place To Stay In Vegas

likes.liked: — That it was close enough to the strip for walking, but was nice & quiet place away from the hustle and bustle!
likes.disliked: — The pool was closed for renovations, but we were able to use the one next door at the Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for a week in exchange for Wyndham points. I agree with other reviewers that the staff was great - friendly and helpful. We had a one bedroom studio suite and it was as big as my first apartment. There was a living room separated from the bedroom by a vertical shade. There was a small dining table and then a pretty good sized full kitchen. It was very quiet there, we never heard anyone in the other rooms, even though they were full. If you're looking for glitz and glam, go somewhere else. This was a very clean, comfortable apartment-like setting, and we really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Great place to stay, very centrally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't opt for a grocery store, but didn't really need one (they said it was $15 each way by cab). The lobby had lots of food items at surprisingly reasonable prices, things like eggs, milk, bread, peanut butter. Everything else we needed we got at the Walgreens which was a couple of blocks away. The rooms have coffee and they'll give you more if you want. I'm pretty picky about coffee, and I thought it was really good.
reviews.title: Quiet Accomodation a block off the strip!

reviews.text: They have a lighted tennis court and very nice pool. They give you the tennis equipment to use, and have basketball too. They have a big selection of dvd's and videos, also complimentary. They're mostly older titles, but some good ones.
reviews.title: Best Bet In Vegas

reviews.text: Someone else complained about the internet, that the cord kept you and your computer at the counter. They gave us one that was about 10 feet long, so we could use it anywhere in the room.
reviews.title: Extremely Pleased!

reviews.text: We walked everywhere, but if you don't like to walk, you should probably get a car. It's not too far off the strip, but it is a couple of big blocks, and most of the casinos are a mile or two away. The Planet Hollywood shopping mall is almost right across the street.
reviews.title: Great place again

reviews.text: Pro:
reviews.title: Viva the c. house

reviews.text: Location - close to the strip (Hard Rock Hotel)
reviews.title: One of the best hotels on our trip

reviews.text: Quiet
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.disliked: — lack of breakfast facilities on site, having to pay for internet cafe

reviews.text: Nice outdoor pool with spa
reviews.title: great for family holiday

reviews.text: Room spacious and neat - complete kitchen with dishwasher etc.
reviews.title: Excellent without any doubt

reviews.text: This hotel is like an oasis of tranquility in the animated city. Great location, yet quiet, nested between the MGM Grand and Planet Hollywood. Easy access to the monorail, under 5mn walk. Very helpful, kind and professional employees.
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly, comfortable, clean.
reviews.title: Perfect place! Inexpensive, quiet, safe & close to shops, restaurants

reviews.text: Small heating outdoor swimming-pool and jacuzzi.
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed this hotel right across from the Miracle Mile mall and Planet Hollywood hotel. Our suite was comfortable -- two adjoining rooms so we had a separate bedroom, living room, kitchen, mini-bar, two bathrooms. No valet parking needed here! Just park right outside the door! The pool was heated and hot tub was never crowded even though it was Spring Break. There was some loud music across the hall from us for awhile, but overall it was relatively quiet and serene compared to the crowds on the strip! Staff was informative and friendly. They recommended Oceans One restaurant across the street for $5.99 breakfast which had excellent pancakes and bacon.
reviews.title: wonderful, but no breakfast.

reviews.text: Highlight of our trip was kayaking right below the Hoover Dam with Evolution Excursions! http://www.lasvegaskayaktours.com/tour_half_day.html
reviews.title: A Real Surprise!

reviews.text: I had booked a trip to the US starting in the US for my mum's XXth birthday (a big one!) We started our trip in Las Vegas and knowing how expensive everything can be I wanted to stay in a nice affordable place. The Carriage House it just what we wanted. Our room had a kitchenette (I think they all do) which has everything you need to cater for yourselves during your stay. The hotel staff are very helpful, there is a pool in front of the hotel, you are less than 5 minutes walk to the Las Vegas Strip, and not far from the monorail at the MGM. They have laundry facilities and internet (which you have to pay for). The big advantage of this hotel is that you are walking distance to just about everything, but can get away from the "bright lights, big city" atmosphere when you've done for the day. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: A little gem in a BIG city!! We LOVED it!

reviews.text: We had a 1 bedroom king room with a queen sleeper sofa in the living room,,,full kitchen which was nice...the room was very clean and comfortable...the hallways could use some paint and updating...
reviews.title: Very Nice Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They had coffee from 8-10am,,,
reviews.title: Not bad, but probably won't stay again

reviews.text: Have internet access and pc with internet/printer to use at extra charge - which was handy as I had an emergency where I needed to print and fax documents.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised -- Great Value

reviews.text: This place is within walking distance - about 2 blocks from the strip - which is close enough but far enough from the hustle and bustle of Vegas...
reviews.title: Better than expected

likes.liked: — Having no casino that you have to fight your way through when you are tired and ready to go to sleep!

reviews.text: This is our first visit to Las Vegas. We do not drive and do not fancy casinos so we prefer to stay on or near the Strip in an affordable accommodation without casinos. The Carriage House is an ideal choice only 2 blocks from the Strip. We stayed in a truly non-smoking one-bedroom suite. (Well, I actually had to sign to undertake that we will not be smoking in the room or I would have to pay for "damages". An ideal arrangement for non-smokers!) It's nothing luxurious but everything is clean and comfortable. We spent 3 nights there and on the last unfortunately there came a group of at least 6 who did not stop drinking and talking loudly going in-and-out of the room directly opposite to us. Lucky that it's a suite and although it was very noisy at the kitchen area, we could not hear them when we slept in the bedroom.
reviews.title: Great stay in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not sure if there's free WiFi in the room but I just could not use it. There are two PCs at the lobby and they work perfectly OK.
reviews.title: perfect!

reviews.text: We bought a $7 day pass for the deuce bus and we had no problems travelling often up and down the Strip. Yes, it sometimes took more than 15 minutes for the wait. As long as you plan for longer travelling time (you would better in Vegas), it's OK. We walked to Bellagio (around 20 minutes) for a wonderful breakfast at Café Bellagio. And had enjoyed the buffet dinner at Wynn. Both highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great place to stay off the strip

reviews.text: Would definitely recommended a stay in here if you are not a keen casino-goer.
reviews.title: This was an amazing find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: once you see the hotel outside, you do not realize how comfortable, friedly, comfortable and inexpensive this hotel is.
reviews.title: I will never stay anywhere else in Vegas!

reviews.text: This is an excellent place to bring your families to. My wife and 2 teenagers stayed in 2 suites. My 2 sisters and their families stayed in 2 additional suites. The Carriage House was glad to put us all on the same floor, which was great. Most of the rooms came with a full size oven, so we could have keesh for breakfast one day. The 1 bedrooms suites rooms have a living area that was large enough for all 14 of us to get together to eat! The place was quiet enough at night, so you could get a good nights sleep. About a block and a half back off the strip between the MGM and Planet Hollywood, it's an excellent location. Go out to The Strip, take a right, and you can walk down to the Bellagio to see the awesome fountain and the Paris hotel. Take a left on the strip and walk to the MGM and NY NY, Excaliber and Luxor. There are Walgreen's and CVS stores a couple blocks away, which really came in handy for snacks, sodas and odds and ends that we needed at decent prices. All in all, one of my favorite places I have stayed at in Vegas!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Family Retreat Location

reviews.text: Just completed a 12 night stay at The Carriage House. While the location was great and the suite amenities (full-size kitchen) perfect for a business traveler, I was extremely disappointed by the daily "maid" service. Aside from making the bed and providing new towels for the bathroom, there seemed to be little, if any, attempt to clean the rest of the suite. Vacuuming was clearly not a priority. Moreover, I don't think that they cleaned the bathroom one time during my two week stay. In addition, the pool was only open for the last four days of my stay. I would think twice about staying at The Carriage House again.
reviews.title: Great location, but could be cleaner!

reviews.text: Our family of 5 (including 3 children) stayed at this property for 3 nights in March. We had a separate bedroom and a pullout sofa in the living room as well as a kitchen. Our spacious room and the hotel property was kept very clean. They provide you with tennis racquets and a basketball to play on their tennis court. The court and the swimming pool are a separate structure located above the parking lot. The pool was undergoing renovations this week, so we were allowed to use the gym and the pool at the Marriott hotel. We used their gym but not the pool. It takes only a few minutes to walk to the LV strip. It is within walking distance to the MGM hotel and right across the street from the Planet Hollywood hotel and their shops. New York, New York, the Excalibur, Monte Carlo and the Bellagio hotels are close by. The kids enjoyed looking through the M&M store (with a 3-D movie upstairs to watch), about a block away if you walk towards MGM. This is a terrific place to stay while visiting LV. I would recommend it to families and to larger groups of people who
reviews.title: Terrific place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: travel together.
reviews.title: best holiday ever

likes.disliked: — not being able to open the windows above acouple of inches

reviews.text: I stayed at the carriage house in Jan. 08. It was a birthday surprise for my husbands 60th. I did not know what to expect, as i had read some poor reviews. Ican only say perhaps the people who were not satisfied must not have researched the accommodation and amenities on site before booking.
reviews.title: Unethical Business Practices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has become my hotel of choice when visiting Vegas! Quietly tucked in behind the big towers, this suite hotel has everything you need, close to the action, quiet when you actually want to sleep and outstanding service. No extra charges here. Free internet and printing for those boarding passes and for staying in touch with home. Our room was spacious and had every thing we needed. The bathroom fixtures are dated but the place was spotless and the walk-in closet and tons of storage space made our week long visit a breeze. Too bad they don't have the shuttle to the grocery store anymore...but the Deuce will take you to Whole Foods.
reviews.title: Gem Among the Big Boys

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reviews for this hotel are spot on, the suites are large with a useable kitchenette, large bedroom with king size bed and nice bathroom with tub and shower. It's a bit noisy at night on the street side with the monorail, so recommend asking for a room on the pool side.
reviews.title: Best deal for a full suite close to the Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and accommodating, and the rooms were clean. Great pool and spa - plus tennis courts. An early check in was no problem. No pressure to attend a time-share meeting. Small 'store' in lobby carried food and laundry items. Laundry on each floor.
reviews.title: Stayed there for honeymoon and loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And best of all the rate was $ 79 a night - we ate out once a day and spend our 'savings' on shows and gambling.
reviews.title: Very pleased with this adequate accommodation
Bathrooms were disgusting
reviews.text: Great location... Short walk to the strip. No smoking and quiet since there's no casino in the building. I had a 1 bedroom suite for $89 a night... I have no complaints and when we go back to Vegas we will stay there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this property last weekend and thought it was an excellent value! My two room suit was cozy/small, but amazing for the price. My room was very clean, the bed was comfortable and I was suprised by the fully equipped kitchen. Its location was very convienient to the central part of the strip.
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.text: We checked into this hotel and it was fine. The second we got off the elevator, ewww... it smelled of musty smoke. Our room was just as smokey, it was gross! We called down about getting a new room and the front desk said there were no more rooms available and that we were in fact on a smoking floor. It was so gross, we opened the window and then had to listen to the street noise all night. We checked out first thing the next morning (3 days early). We would not stay here again, the room was run down as well.
reviews.title: This is NOT a smoke free hotel!

reviews.text: At first was unsure because never heard of this hotel. After reading the reviews decided to give it a whirl. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The room was emmaculate and we are happy we decided to stay at a non-gaming hotel and smoke-free. For busines this was great we were suppose to stay in Planet Hollywood. The internet and printing is free (in the rooms also). Will definitely stay here if ever in Vegas again.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is the overall key to this place. It is very close to Planet H. and MGM. This is basically just the place to sleep. This is an older hotel. so the carpet in the halls somewhat still smells of cigarette smoke which was hrd with some in our party that had allergies. Although the hotel itself is non-smoker from my understanding. We had problems with the older toliets. But once again, a place to sleep is what we needed as we spent most of the time walking on The Stip and touring the other hotels. The "24 Hour Concierge" mentioned is actually a time share sales person so be warned. We will stay somewhere else next time, but if your low on cash or its your first time; go for it.
reviews.title: If you want the best location at a cheap price, this is the place!

reviews.text: I would definitely stay at The Carriage House again. The experience was excellent. The rooms are really clean, they have everything you need, the attention is great and the location is excellent. Just one block from the strip, and really cheap for being a Saturday night. The only problem was the sofa bed; it was uncomfortable and noisy but everything else was just wonderful.
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise!

aka: The Carriage House Hotel Las Vegas
description: The Carriage House is located just a block away from the excitement of the Las Vegas Strip. Enjoy the comfortable accommodations, fully equipped kitchenettes or kitchens, business center and fitness room. Guest services and concierges are always available to provide information about show tickets, tour information and dinner reservations. Our non-gaming Las Vegas hotel is ideal for leisure and business travel, family travel and romantic getaways.
